Good play what always make fun.

This game can be a lot of fun, but for survivors mostly just with friends. The community is the most toxic I've come across in a game though there are some great people. The person playing the killer has a huge influence on the quality of the game play. the most popular play style they are using right now has them just camping by a hooked person, then knocking down that person when others try to rescue, which makes for very boring games. You'll get a great game with a competent killer about 1 out of 4 games. In those cases, the game changes character entirely and it becomes very exciting. 

When I play as killer, I have to put limits and rules on the game myself to make it fun and challenging such as always leave the scene of a hooked player so they can be rescued, and not immediately rehook the same player. with that I still end up killing all survivors pretty often

When you have the current typical crappy camping killer, you will see survivors disconnect from the game, rather than waste time in a boring round. I don't personally disconnect as it makes the game even worse for those who stay. The developer's response to that has been to punish those that disconnect, rather than address the mechanics and scoring that encourage the current poor game play style of the killers.

So when the games play out as intended it's great fun, but the majority of your games in it's current form will not be that.
Never had such a love hate relationship for a game until i stumbled upon dbd. I have hundreds of hours on the ps4 edition and definitely recommend.

nice game, gives me that rising feeling in your nuts every now and then when running away from satan himself.

I can't support BHVR with a positive review of DBD anymore after their recent decisions regarding NFTs.

Full transparency ~ this review was originally positive and I had a ton of awards on it. I had to clear the awards to edit this review and it's worth it.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I recommend this game if you're playing with friends.

I have an intense love/hate relationship with Dead by Daylight, and I feel as though I've logged enough hours into it to write a fair review. If you're just here wondering if the community is as toxic as everyone says it is ... well, yes, it is. I wouldn't say it's any more or less toxic than the communities you'd find in CS:GO, Overwatch, Fortnite, etc. ... but post-game chat can definitely frighten off a new player.

If you're new to the game, I highly recommend playing it with one or more experienced friends who can coach you. If you don't have a thick skin or much patience, playing solo right off the bat will likely make you rage quit. That being said, a lot of people will only have fun with DbD if they're playing with friends. And that's okay and completely fair. The basis of 4v1 gameplay is cooperation, and you can't guarantee that a random is going to have your back.

There was a period where I took this game very seriously, and it ruined it for me for a while. After taking a break, I came back and swore I'd only play it for fun anymore, disconnecting the second I felt myself getting even slightly salty or competitive (EDIT ~ I can't even believe that I have to say this, but I'll take partial blame for it because of my wording. After someone took the time to go to my profile and flame me for this review instead of commenting right below where I could actually respond, I felt the need to clarify that I did not mean that I disconnect in-game. I'll finish a match and quit playing. I'll admit that "disconnect" wasn't the correct word, and I should've just said "stop playing". You could've said that instead of just criticizing me altogether when you've never played with me. Truly, the toxicity over the wording I'm leaving here in my review proves how right I am about the community, eh? But anyone who has spent time playing DbD knows it all-too-well.)

I'm a survivor main, but I enjoy playing killer every once in a while. I think it's extremely important for every DbD player to experience playing killer. You'll have toxicity in-game and post-game when you're a survivor, but there's really nothing that can prepare you for post-game chat when you're the killer. I tend to minimize the chat so I don't see it, or I change my username to something friendly (which no one should have to do, but I'm a lover, not a fighter). While playing killer can help thicken your skin against the community, it's really helpful in learning to be a better teammate while playing survivor. There's also a killer for everyone. While I want to be the best with every killer in the game, I've succumbed to the fact that it's just not a possibility for me and tried every killer until I found one that matched my play style.

I do have a lot of gripes about the developers, as do most players. Every update seems to fix something but break something else. Server lag is atrocious, and, lately, matchmaking is a complete joke (you're supposed to be matched with players on your skill level, but it's really not unusual to be shoved into a lobby with players way below or way above your skill level anymore). Certain perks are broken, hitboxes are BS, and you'll be kicked from lobbies, menus, and matches, requiring you to have to restart the game completely.

There are kind and gentle players in this game, and they're honestly the ones who kept me around when I first started playing. I'll never forget my first time playing killer in a public match. I was nervous and played terribly. Post-game chat, a more experienced player encouraged me: "You're a good killer - just watch your tracking." They hung around and gave me some advice for practicing. Granted, every post-game after that was toxic ... but that energized me enough to keep trying. I try to reciprocate that to newer players when I can.

Dead by daylight is an easy to understand game. The concept makes sense and is therefore easy to play based on the method of use. The game itself is suitable for all within its age range. The graphics are pretty good given the multiplayer span. The variety of killers/characters is good with enough opportunity to level up/rank up you characters with perks/additional items to better yourself in the game.

Dead by Daylight is a must for anyone who enjoys the horror genre. It is a mild paced game, with each match lasting roughly 20-30 min. Definitely play with a friend, it makes the experience 10x better.

このゲームは、僕に潜在的に存在するーマゾヒズムーを刺激する。
僕がこのゲームを初めてプレイしたのは、まだ冬の寒さが残る初春のことだった。窓の外では肌寒い風が音を立てて踊っていた。友人に勧められ始めたわけだが、最初、僕はショックを受けた。暗い森の中に誘われ、唖然とする僕を、まるで恐々とした素顔を隠すかの様に奇妙な仮面を着け、巨大で鋭利な刃物を持った大男に追われたのだ。突然の事だった。僕はその男に後ろから二度も斬りつけられた。気が付けば、見た事の無い巨大なフックに吊るされ、黒光りの触手ーそれはとても奇怪で、まるで幽冥を体現しているかの様だったーに連れ去られてしまった。しかし、不思議とそれは、僕に恐怖ではなく、どこか恍惚感、いや、快感をもたらしたのだ。本来ならば恐怖すべき場面のはずなのだが、僕はその化け物に魅了され、気が付けば虜になっていたのだ。やれやれ、僕にこの感情をどう抑制しろというのだ。僕の内面には所謂、ーマゾヒズムーが宿っていたのだろうか。それは果たして罪な事なのだろうか。僕は、この事についてこのゲームを勧めてくれた友人に尋ねてみた。友人ー君の気持ちは理解してやりたいが、今の僕には少し難しいかもしれないーもちろん、彼にこの問いの正解を導く義務は無い。最も、僕は正解なんて求めていなかった。それに、僕はこの問いの答えを知る勇気さえも持ち合わせていなかった。それからは、彼とは疎遠になった。僕は突然、深海に放り込まれた様な悲壮感を覚えた。そして数日が経ち、僕はある決心をした。それは、自らの意に正直になる、というものだった。初めのうちは抵抗があった。もちろん、あの大男や化け物からの冷徹で凌辱的な仕打ちは、いつも僕を舞い上がらせ、興奮させた。しかし、僕の心には、まだ歯止めが掛かっていたのだ。いまいちこのゲームに感情を移入させる事が出来ず思い描いている快楽を得る事が出来なくなっていた。そこで、僕は、一度彼らと同じ視点に立ってみようと思った。自分でも馬鹿げていると思った。僕は今までーマゾヒズムーに拘り、大切な友人まで失った。そんな僕が、ーマゾヒズムーとは、まるで対照的で、けれど、どこか親近感も感じさせる所謂、ーサディズムーの立場に身を置いたのだ。そして、僕は、あの奇妙な仮面を着けた大男の様に巨大な刃物を手にした。
気が付けば、僕は、森の深淵にいた。すると目の前に女が立っていた。僕が、その女に目をやると、女は三つ編みの髪を揺らしながら物凄い速さで僕から逃げて行った。それは、捕食者から逃げ惑う獲物の様だった。その時、僕は、衝動的に彼女を追いかけた。すると女は器用に窓を飛び越え僕の攻撃を悉くかわしていったのだ。挙句の果てに、僕に巨大な板をぶつけてきた。よろける頭を必死に抑え、また女に目をやると、女は屈伸運動をしていた。僕には、女が何をしているのか分からなかったし、分かろうともしなかった。しかし、その光景を見ていると、何故か、あの時感じた快楽が蘇ってきたのだ。その時、僕の心の中で何かが壊れた音がした。決して目には見えないが、着実に僕の心で何かがボロボロと音を立てて崩れていた。結局、僕が、原因不明の快楽に浸っている間に、その女には逃げられてしまった。巨大な扉を開け、女は森の外へ出て行ったが、女は最後まで屈伸運動を続けていた。試合を終え、僕は、一人部屋で考え事をしていた。いつもならこんな時には、熱いコーヒーでも嗜むのだが、それさえも忘れ、考え事に没頭していた。僕には、何故、本来なら人に苦痛を与え快感を得るはずのーサディズムーの立場だった僕が、あの時、ーマゾヒズムーの快感を得たのか分からなかった。僕は、窓を開け、冷え込んだ空気を肺いっぱいに吸い込んだ。そして、僕は、吹っ切れたように刃物を手にし、あの快楽を求め、また森の中へと足を運んだ。

after the new update with boon totems i wouldn't waste your money. no one plays killer so your survivor wait time is like 30 minutes. if you do play killer expect to get steamrolled and told you are trash. i have now uninstalled the game because it is not fun anymore. when it was good it was good. now its just trash and a waste of money.

Jogo é bom, muito louco, fugir, correr, se esconder, ai vem um filho da puta sanguinario e você não tem nem uma pistola pra acabar com a raça desse verme, sério, quem vai pra uma fazenda, um hospicio ou sei la, pro satanás que te carregue sem nem ao menos ter um fuzil? No geral não é um jogo de  terror é um jogo de 4 idiotas passando raiva por não terem uma bazuca pra matar o filho da puta maniaco correndo atrás de você, divirta-se
